Package GOL

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • GOL.Game
  • class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game rules:
    1. Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbors dies, as if by underpopulation.
    2. Any live cell with two or three live neighbors lives on to the next generation.
    3. Any live cell with more than three live neighbors dies, as if by overpopulation.
    4. Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbors becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wojtas

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void check​(int c, int d)
      method for checking number of alive neighbours for each cell and taking actions:
      if cell is dead and has 3 alive neighbours, cell become alive else remain dead
      if cell is alive and has 2 or 3 alive neighbours, cell remain alive else dies
      void display()
      method displays current board where '#' means alive cell
      void fillBoard()
      first generation (starting pattern)
      void updateBoard()
      method counting new generation using method check() and moving next generation to board for current one
